{"step_by_step_thinking": "Protracted vomiting can be a symptom of various conditions, including gastrointestinal disorders, infections, or even drug-induced nausea and vomiting. The fact that the patient developed abnormal posturing after receiving an anti-emetic drug suggests the possibility of a dystonic reaction, which is a known side effect of certain medications. Dystonic reactions are characterized by abnormal posturing or muscle contractions and can occur as an adverse effect of certain anti-emetic drugs. Among the options provided, metoclopramide is the most likely drug to cause dystonic reactions. Therefore, the most likely drug given to the patient is A. Metoclopramide.", "answer_choice": "A"}
